name: Always even numbers
instruction:
Write a function `alwaysEven` that takes a number and returns the same number if it is even, and the next even number if it is odd.

This will help you:
```javascript
const num = 10;
console.log(num % 2); // 0
```

If the number is even, then the remainder of division by 2 will be 0.

If the number is odd, the remainder of division by 2 will be greater than 0.

Examples of function execution:
```javascript
alwaysEven(10); // 10
alwaysEven(11); // 12
alwaysEven(12); // 12
alwaysEven(13); // 14
```

Use the `===` triple equal, strict equality operator to compare with zero.
``javascript
const num = 0;
console.log(num === 0); // true
```
